30012.name: Memoria sacerdotal

30013.description:
Los recuerdos de alguien que hizo grandes milagros.
Esta magatama contiene los sentimientos de un ángel enviado a la tierra y continúa haciendo milagros hoy en día. Concede un misterioso poder a los espíritus divinia.
30013.name: Memoria misteriosa

30014.description:
Los recuerdos de un shogun que dirigió muchas campañas militares.
Esta magatama contiene su admirada gallardía y su deseo de crear un mundo en paz. Concede deseos de paz a los espíritus divinia.
30014.name: Memoria del shogun

30015.description:
Los recuerdos de un tirano que gobernaba el mundo.
Esta magatama contiene la osada actitud del tirano hacia la vida. A los espíritus divinia les concede el poder necesario para controlar el mundo.
30015.name: Memoria tiránica

30021.description:
Las desternillantes bromas que gastaba un diablillo...
Esta magatama contiene los recuerdos de todas esas bromas. Hace muy felices a los espíritus fantasmia.
30021.name: Memoria traviesa

30022.description:
Las innumerables fechorías de un demonio...
Esta magatama contiene los recuerdos de cómo las llevó a cabo. Aumenta el conocimiento del mal de todos los espíritus fantasmia.
30022.name: Memoria diabólica

30023.description:
Los recuerdos de un demonio que ansiaba la destrucción del mundo.
Esta magatama contiene el rencor que surge del dolor y que sigue ardiendo hoy en día. Trasmite este sentimiento a los espíritus fantasmia y aumenta su poder.
30023.name: Memoria destructiva

30024.description:
Los recuerdos de un demonio tristemente célebre por provocar desastres.
Esta magatama contiene la brutalidad del demonio, la cual llenaba de terror los corazones. Proporciona a los espíritus fantasmia la capacidad de ser despiadados.
30024.name: Memoria despiadada

30025.description:
Los recuerdos de quien reinaba sobre todos los demonios.
Esta magatama contiene un gran poder y emite una extraña luz. Imbuye a los espíritus fantasmia de la fuerza del rey diabólico y les confiere un poder descomunal.
30025.name: Memoria de rey diabólico

30031.description:
Los recuerdos de un tesoro muy querido.
Esta magatama contiene el sentimiento de felicidad que proporcionaba un objeto que no era nada fuera de lo común, pero que fue tratado con mucho cariño. Hace muy felices a los espíritus animia.
30031.name: Memoria corriente

30032.description:
Los recuerdos de la espada que portaba un caballero andante.
Esta magatama contiene la preocupación por la seguridad del su nuevo señor. Proporciona a los espíritus animia la fuerza para proteger a otros.
30032.name: Memoria de caballería

30033.description:
Los recuerdos de la espada favorita de un caballero excepcional.
Esta magatama contiene la determinación que sentía la espada cuando juró proteger a su dueño. Contagia a los espíritus animia el deseo de proteger a su agente.
30033.name: Memoria enternecedora

30034.description:
Los recuerdos de una espada con el poder de exorcizar el mal.
Esta magatama contiene los vivos recuerdos de la espada favorita de un renombrado caballero, con la que libró mil y una batallas. Proporciona fuerza y benevolencia a los espíritus animia.
30034.name: Memoria de espada sagrada

30035.description:
Los recuerdos de la espada que un caballero, considerado un dios de la guerra, portaba como amuleto de la buena suerte.
Esta magatama alberga los recuerdos de la espada protegiendo al caballero, incluso después del combate. Proporciona poderes casi ilimitados a los espíritus animia.
30035.name: Memoria de deidad guerrera

30041.description:
Un cupón con la imagen de una piedra de alma, expedido por la Agencia de lo Oculto y concedido a quienes alcanzan logros menores.

«Si los acumulas, podrás cambiarlos por piedras de alma. Estoy todo el día repartiéndolos, así que vuelve cuando puedas recibir más».
30041.name: Cupón de piedras de alma: menor

30042.description:
Un cupón con la imagen de una piedra de alma, expedido por la Agencia de lo Oculto y concedido a quienes alcanzan logros medios.

«Puedes cambiarlo por un puñado de piedras de alma. Si quieres más, tendrás que seguir afanándote en el trabajo».
30042.name: Cupón de piedras de alma: medio

30043.description:
Un cupón con la imagen de una piedra de alma, expedido por la Agencia de lo Oculto y concedido a quienes alcanzan logros moderados.

«Te proporcionará un buen número de piedras de alma. Te lo mereces por todo lo que has trabajado últimamente».
30043.name: Cupón de piedras de alma: moderado

30044.description:
Un cupón con la imagen de una piedra de alma, expedido por la Agencia de lo Oculto y concedido a quienes alcanzan un gran mérito.

«Te proporcionará tantas piedras de alma que no podrás parar de sonreír. ¡Te las has ganado, créeme!».
30044.name: Cupón de piedras de alma: mayor

30045.description:
Un cupón con la imagen de una piedra de alma expedido, por la Agencia de lo Oculto y concedido a quienes alcanzan un mérito incomparable.

«Te proporcionará más piedras de alma de las que te podrías imaginar. No se lo doy a cualquiera, pero alguien de tu calibre se lo merece sobradamente».
30045.name: Cupón de piedras de alma: máximo

abilities.description: Sube enormemente el daño causado.
abilities.name: Five Great Blades

abilities.description: Sube enormemente el daño crítico.
abilities.name: Onimaru's Determination

301.description:
"Shall my blade never grow dull..."
The spirit of one of the Five Great Blades. In the past she made a major series of blunders in the line of duty, later realizing they were due to her own folly and weak spirit. Aiming for self-improvement, she learned of the beach contest. She decided that appearing in front of others in a bathing suit would be a good way to strengthen her resolve, only learning about the granted wish after already deciding to participate. At that point she just considered it a stroke of good luck, or icing on the cake, if you will.
301.name: Onimaru Kunitsuna [Defiant]

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño a los rivales lejanos.
skill.name: Flash and Slash

abilities.description: Reduce enormemente el daño sufrido.
abilities.name: To Wear a Swimsuit

abilities.description: Sube enormemente el daño de destrezas con {#MonsterName#293} en el equipo.
abilities.name: Memories of Summer

302.description:
"I just want to be at Urashima Taro's side..."
The spirit of the princess living in the Dragon Palace in the oceans off Japan's coast. She joined the beach contest in order to fulfill a secret wish held deep in her heart. Her followers and retainers even joined her in order to help her wish come true. While they were defeated, it all worked out for the best. She and Urashima Taro have grown closer now, and everyone is wondering when she'll finally tell him how she feels.

changes.new: Increases 20% of Skill DMG when Urashima Taro is on the team.
changes.old: Increases 20% of Skill DMG when {#MonsterName#293} is on the team.

302.name: Princess Oto [Ocean Flower]

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño a todos los rivales.
skill.name: Deep Sea Dance

abilities.description: Sube moderadamente el daño causado con uno de los «Cuatro Reyes Celestiales de Raiko» en el equipo.
abilities.name: Heavenly King of Raiko

303.description:
"The ocean's calling me, man..."
One of the Four Heavenly Kings of Raiko who rid the capital of the evil that lurked within. He joined Amanogawa's contest at the request of his friend Urashima Taro, and now he's devoted his mind, body, and soul to fulfilling his wish to become good-looking. Urashima Taro may or may not also be the one responsible for Kintaro's stoic yet provocative new appearance.
303.name: Kintaro [Vacation]

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño a los rivales de alrededor y reduce temporalmente su velocidad un {delay1}.
skill.name: Sea Monster Killer

abilities.description: Otorga bastante probabilidad de aturdir con ataques de destreza.
abilities.name: Nation-Destroying Beauty

304.description:
"Me? I'm just here to watch..."
The spirit of possibly the most evil woman in all of human history. Currently taking human form, she enjoys spending her days as a high school student. She apparently came to the beach just to hang out with friends, completely unrelated to the beach contest. Since she can grant her own wishes any time she feels like it, she couldn't care less about the prize. She'd rather just enjoy herself in the sun, watching from the sidelines as contestants frantically compete—and men try to flirt with her.
304.name: Daji [Seductive Swimsuit]

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño al rival con menos HP. Los objetivos sufren un +{delay1} de daño temporalmente.
skill.name: Alluring Gaze

abilities.description: Sube enormemente el daño de destrezas.
abilities.name: God of the Underworld

abilities.description: Sube enormemente la tasa de golpes críticos.
abilities.name: Helmet of Hiding

305.description:
"Don't worry, the Underworld isn't actually all that bad."
The god of the Underworld in Greek mythology. The elder brother of Poseidon and Zeus, he's just as powerful as his siblings, if not more so. Most people assume he's evil since he's the king of the Underworld, and while this is certainly reflected in his appearance and abilities, he's actually extremely kind. And the Underworld is in fact much more peaceful than you might expect. He puts everything he's got into making sure that people have a good first impression when they arrive.
305.name: Hades

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño a los rivales lejanos.
skill.name: Scythe of Hades

abilities.description: Sube moderadamente el daño de destrezas.
abilities.name: Lobo solitario

abilities.description: Reduce moderadamente el daño causado de los rivales divinia al iniciar una ronda.
abilities.name: Cazador de dioses

306.description:
[«Muéstrame tu habilidad con la espada...».]
El espíritu de un monstruo de la mitología escandinava. Como carece de la pasión por las bromas de su padre Loki, Fenrir ha desarrollado una personalidad sobria y se dedica a sermonear a los demás. Es tan serio que le llaman «el único con buen corazón de su familia», que, encabezada por Loki, es famosa por su rebeldía. La verdad es que Fenrir usa la lógica para refrenar sus ansias de combate. Habiendo heredado la rapidez mental y el impresionante intelecto de su padre, se ha profetizado que Fenrir acabará con el mismísimo Odín, el dios más poderoso de la mitología escandinava.
306.name: Fenrir

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño al objetivo actual.
skill.name: Colmillo de lobo

abilities.description: Reduce enormemente el daño sufrido.
abilities.name: Bendición inmutable

abilities.description: Te vuelve inmune al veneno y sube ligeramente el daño causado.
abilities.name: Espada consagrada

307.description:
[«¿Es el momento de cumplir con mi deber? Entiendo, así lo haré».]
El espíritu de una espada sagrada, una de las cuatro célebres reliquias sagradas. Durandarte es indestructible, y su hermosa y suave hoja nunca de desafila. Según la leyenda, su poder proviene de las bendiciones protectoras de los santos. En una ocasión, hace muchos siglos, Roldán, el héroe que empuñaba Durandarte, trató de destruir su hoja. Desde entonces, el espíritu evita establecer lazos emocionales con nadie. Si a eso le sumamos la timidez innata de Durandarte, se entiende que parezca un espíritu frío y distante.
307.name: Durandarte

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño a la fila de rivales directamente al frente.  Los objetivos sufren un +{delay1} de daño temporalmente.
skill.name: Filo inmutable

abilities.description: Sube ligeramente el daño causado de los aliados.
abilities.name: La valquiria

308.description:
[«¡Ah! ¿He vuelto a equivocarme?».]
El espíritu de una valquiria que guiaba a los espíritus de los guerreros caídos hasta los salones de Valhalla. Siente un profundo amor por Sigfrido el Matadragones y le ha enseñado muchas cosas. Antiguamente, trabajaba para Odín eligiendo a los vencedores en las batallas más importantes. Sin embargo, tras equivocarse y darle la victoria al bando incorrecto en una ocasión, Brunilda perdió su divinidad. Avergonzada, se escondió en las montañas. Tras años viviendo como una exiliada, conoció a Sigfrido, que se encontraba viajando por esa zona, y se enamoraron al instante. Habiendo encontrado la felicidad en los brazos de Sigfrido, Brunilda ya no se arrepiente de su equivocación.
308.name: Brunilda

skill.description: Sube temporalmente el daño causado de todos los aliados un {delay1}.
skill.name: Dictamen de valquiria

309.description:
[«¿Alguien ha dicho "gárgolas"?».]
El espíritu masculino de una estatua con forma de demonio. Gárgola comenzó su vida como una grotesca estatua que también servía de desagüe para la lluvia. Si le pides que te explique la diferencia entre una gárgola y una escultura normal, te pasarás el resto del día escuchando una disertación improvisada sobre el tema y, al día siguiente, te dará una larguísima charla académica titulada «Así habló la Gárgola», ilustrada con fotografías. Por último, Gárgola entregará a los oyentes un libro con una lista completa de referencias de las fotos originales con anotaciones, publicado de su propio bolsillo. Sorprendentemente, este libro se ha hecho tan popular entre los agentes espirituales que Gárgola está pensando en hacer una segunda edición o incluso una secuela.
309.name: Gárgola

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño al objetivo actual, con {probability} de aturdirlos.
skill.name: Puño esculpido

31.description:
«Uoooaah.. ¿Qué? ¿Más práctica? Qué rollo...».
El espíritu de la elfa surgida del elemento níquel. Tras fijarse en cómo bailaban los humanos, crearon un grupo de baile llamado ELF 118. Tienen un montón de bailarinas, algunas mejores que otras, pero cada vez se están haciendo más famosas.
31.name: Elfa de níquel

skill.description: Sube temporalmente el daño causado de un aliado aleatorio un {delay1}.
skill.name: Baile de vitalidad

310.description:
[«Te protegeré de cualquier ataque durante la noche».]
El espíritu de una espada que emana gotas de rocío. Cuantas más ganas de matar tenga quien la empuña, más humedad emite la hoja y más fría se hace al tacto. Conocida por su despiadada profesionalidad, Murasamemaru no duda en aceptar las misiones más difíciles ni las éticamente cuestionables. Se dice que todos los años que ha pasado trabajando en los bajos fondos de la sociedad le han proporcionado un conocimiento profundo del lado oscuro del alma humana, un conocimiento que le resulta muy útil para evitar las tragedias antes de que se produzcan.
310.name: Murasamemaru

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño al rival con más PS.
skill.name: Congelación

abilities.description: Sube enormemente el daño de destrezas.
abilities.name: Bestia auspiciosa

abilities.description: Sube ligeramente el daño crítico de los aliados divinia al iniciar una ronda.
abilities.name: Ave celestial

311.description:
[«¿Adónde debo ir para mi siguiente misión?».]
El espíritu de un ave legendaria. Dicen que, en su búsqueda de alguien digno de su lealtad, el Fénix solo aparece ante aquellos con la capacidad de gobernar el mundo. Entrenando noche y día, se dice que el Fénix desea convertirse en el más poderoso de los animales legendarios, en un ser al que venerar. Sus grandes esfuerzos lo han hecho merecedor del respeto del resto de los espíritus. Aseguran que hasta Mikado lo trata con respeto.
311.name: Fénix

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño a todos los rivales, con {probability} de quemarlos.
skill.name: Danza del huracán

abilities.description: Sube enormemente el daño causado.
abilities.name: Espíritu desafiante

312.description:
[«No me importa que vengan gatos».]
El espíritu femenino de una longeva rata. A lo largo de su extensa vida, Kyuso ha entablado una sincera amistad con muchos gatos, a pesar de que normalmente son los enemigos mortales de su especie. Es habitual ver a Kyuso jugando con los espíritus felinos con los que ha confraternizado, riéndose mientras agita un junco para divertirlos. Esa visión despierta una sonrisa incluso en el rostro de las personas más serias. Se rumorea que, en realidad, Kyuso está llevando a cabo una misión secreta para las ratas con la intención de acabar con todos los gatos. Seguramente esto sea mentira, ya que no pega con su personalidad.
312.name: Kyuso

skill.description: Restaura {value} de PS y sube temporalmente su daño un {delay1}.
skill.name: Alma de rata

313.description:
[«No te preocupes; solo será un pinchacito...».]
Un espíritu femenino cuyos cabellos terminan en afilados garfios metálicos. Pelipúa es conocida por atrapar a sus víctimas con su pelo. Dicen que cuando las cosas se ponen feas, el cabello de Pelipúa cobra vida propia y enreda a sus enemigos en un abrazo mortal, incluso aunque ella le ordene que los suelte. Quienes han sufrido ese abrazo describen la experiencia como ser aplastado vivo por cables de acero indestructible. Pese a los múltiples usos que podría darle a su cabello, se dice que Pelipúa usa sus técnicas más refinadas con los hombres a los que desea...
313.name: Pelipúa

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño al rival con más ATQ y lo aturde con {probability}.
skill.name: Dulce trampa

abilities.description: Increases 50% of DMG dealt at the start of the final wave.
abilities.name: Spirit of Fireworks

314.description:
"Come on! Let's go out with a bang!"
The spirit of a firework which sprays colorful sparks into the air. In the summer, this spirit travels near and far to make sure firework displays don't fizzle and flop. Roman's hair is a vertical mane of flames that acts as an emotional barometer. The more excited he becomes, the more his mane seethes, its color growing deeper shades of red. As a result, his hair is constantly alive with activity when watching firework displays, and explodes towards the heavens while in combat. In fact, some say that no living person has seen his hair in its normal, relaxed state...begging the question if it really can be called an emotional barometer when he only seems to have one mood: excited.
[Event] The Great Fireworks Showdown
314.name: Roman Candell

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to 3 enemies (ranged priority), with a {probability} of inflicting Burn.
skill.name: Flame Pillar

abilities.description: Increases 20% of skill DMG and Reduces 15% of DMG taken.
abilities.name: Dual Wield

315.description:
"I'll show you what some training can do."
The spirit of the master swordsman whose famous duel on Ganryu Island became the stuff of legend. After becoming spirits, Musashi and rival Kojiro faced off once again, but despite Musashi's confidence in his own strength, he lost their rematch to Kojiro's diligent training. Pained by his defeat, Musashi committed himself to a brutal training regimen of his own, allowing him to stand victorious over his rival the following year. Ever since, the pair have dueled once a year, each striving to gain the upper hand against an ever-improving opponent. Needless to say, both Musashi and Kojiro hate to lose.
[Event] The Great Fireworks Showdown
315.name: Miyamoto Musashi

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to current target.
skill.name: Twin Strike

abilities.description: Decrease 5% of the ATK speed of all foes at the start of each wave.
abilities.name: Ruler of Winds

316.description:
"You'll worship me, won't you?"
An evil spirit that controls arid winds. In the past, Pazuzu was feared for spreading fevered illnesses throughout the populace. Witnessing Pazuzu's horror firsthand, some people even tried to use her in the fight against other evil spirits by drawing her image on protective charms. Delighted at the portrayal of her likeness, Pazuzu befriended the humans, and set about destroying the evil that was besieging them. After an incident while exorcising evil spirits, Pazuzu herself became a spirit and built a relationship with the Bureau of the Occult. Controlling hot winds, Pazuzu works to guarantee the perfect conditions for a spirit-world firework festival. With her around, the event is sure to go off with a bang. Despite her 'evil spirit' moniker, Pazuzu is never happier than when someone she helped shows her gratitude.
[Event] The Great Fireworks Showdown
316.name: Pazuzu

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to all enemies.
skill.name: Savage Winds

317.description:
"Kaboom! The sky's the limit!"
Blasting off wildly, Rocket Firework is the playful spirit of rockets used in the firework festival of a small town in Greece. More powerful than most Japanese fireworks, Bottie is famed among firework spirits as a high-flyer with considerable range. In battle, she uses her impressive mobility to toy with enemies. The only problem is that her phenomenal momentum makes it tough to regroup when enemies step out of the way.
[Event] The Great Fireworks Showdown
317.name: Rocket Firework

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño a un rival (prioridad a distancia).
skill.name: Rocket Barrage

abilities.description: Increases 20% of skill DMG.
abilities.name: Firework Artisan

318.description:
"In the fleeting moment lies true beauty."
One of the two master firework artisans that captured the imaginations of the people in Edo-era Japan. Inheriting the knowledge of artisans throughout the ages, Kagi was an innovator who created new and exciting rockets to compete with rival and close friend, Tama. The spirit world firework festival was said to have been started by the pair after their competition to make ever more beautiful displays resulted in the creation of fireworks they couldn't launch with their spirit essence alone.
[Special Bond] Increases Firework Artisan Tama's skill DMG
[Event] The Great Fireworks Showdown

[Special Bond] Increases {#MonsterName#319}'s skill DMG
[Event] The Great Fireworks Showdown

318.name: Firework Artisan Kagi

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño a 3 rivales (prioridad CaC).
skill.name: Firework Flare

abilities.description: Increases 20% of skill DMG.
abilities.name: Firework Artisan

319.description:
"Impressive right? It's my finest work yet!"
One of the two master firework artisans that captured the imaginations of the people of Edo-era Japan. Originally working under Firework Artisan Kagi, Tama quickly proved herself by learning all her master had to teach before setting up shop on her own, becoming her old master's friend and biggest rival. Putting her genius to good use, Tama is known for inventive, original creations, though some say they don't meet with the approval of firework traditionalists.
[Special Bond] Increases Firework Artisan Kagi's skill DMG
[Event] The Great Fireworks Showdown

changes.new:
"Impressive right? It's my finest work yet!"

[Event] The Great Fireworks Showdown

319.name: Firework Artisan Tama

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño al rival con más PS.
skill.name: Rocket Wheel

32.description:
«Otro día y otro combate. ¿A quién me enfrentaré hoy?».
El espíritu de un soldado de infantería que estuvo al mando de un comandante militar. Es bastante diestro, pero optó por no convertirse en un guerrero de renombre. Le encanta combatir y la euforia que se siente al estar en primera línea de frente. Su fama se ha extendido entre sus compañeros y hay ejércitos rivales que le llaman Yashichi, el Tigre. Nadie sabe mucho más sobre él.

changes.new:
"Another day, another fight. Who will I face today?"
The spirit of a common foot soldier who once served under a military commander. He is very skilled, but he chose not to become a famous warrior. He loves the battlefield and the stinging joy of being on the front lines. He's really famous for this among his fellow soldiers, and other armies fearfully refer to him as "Yashichi the Tiger." No one knows much about him beyond that.
[Special Bond] Increases Commander Yashichi's skill DMG
changes.old:
"Another day, another fight. Who will I face today?"
The spirit of a common foot soldier who once served under a military commander. He is very skilled, but he chose not to become a famous warrior. He loves the battlefield and the stinging joy of being on the front lines. He's really famous for this among his fellow soldiers, and other armies fearfully refer to him as "Yashichi the Tiger." No one knows much about him beyond that.
[Special Bond] Increases {#MonsterName#330}'s skill DMG

32.name: Yashichi

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño al objetivo actual.
skill.name: Ronda tras ronda

abilities.description: Skill attacks have 50% chances of inflicting Burn.
abilities.name: Flames of the Ninja

abilities.description: Increases 20% of skill DMG.
abilities.name: Mystic Flame

320.description:
"My transformation techniques put a ninja to shame."
The spirit of a mysterious flame, legendary in the Kyushu region of Japan. Rumor has it that Shiranui was saved by a ninja spirit while on a mission. Enthralled by the ninja's stealth and graceful efficiency, Shiranui took to wearing ninja garb. Her own abilities have allowed her to recreate ninja transformation techniques, and many have remarked at how well the get-up suits her. Shiranui actively seeks out large gatherings such as festivals in the hope of gathering information that might lead to her being reunited with the ninja who saved her life. Turns out that gathering information on ninjas isn't as easy as she'd hoped...
[Event] The Great Fireworks Showdown
320.name: Shiranui

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño a todos los rivales.
skill.name: Arcane Fire Transformation

abilities.description: Restores 50% HP to the ally with the lowest percentage of HP at the start of each wave.
abilities.name: Saintly Defender

abilities.description: Reduces 10% DMG taken.
abilities.name: Yukata

321.description:
"I've never known a fire to feel so inviting."
The spirit of a saint who fought for her homeland. Despite a troubled past, Joan of Arc lives up to her saintly reputation after having returned to her gentle self. Joan was intrigued by the idea of a fireworks festival when Sola extended her an invitation to attend. Unfamiliar with modern fireworks, Joan is unaware of how they work. She has been seen desperately trying to set off store-bought rockets with nothing but her spirit essence.
[Event] The Great Fireworks Showdown
321.name: Joan of Arc [Fireworks]

skill.description: Restaura {value} de PS a todos los aliados y sube temporalmente su daño un {delay1}.
skill.name: Sacred Fires

abilities.description: All melee allies take 5% less DMG
abilities.name: Heart of Defense

abilities.description: Increases 10% of the skill DMG of all ranged allies
abilities.name: Secure Bastion

322.description:
"I will shelter everyone."
The spirit of the largest castle in Japan. Edo Castle is known to accompany spirits who think of themselves as vassals of the state. Edo Castle was said to have been constructed with feng shui and yin-yang principles in mind, giving her the impressive defensive capabilities that she's become famous for. When Edo Castle is on the defensive, she casts a protective barrier, repelling any attacks an enemy may throw at those around her. In her benevolence, she turns a blind eye to injured foes, refusing to attack. It's undoubtedly this kindness that draws other spirits; it's not uncommon to see groups of spirits congregating around her.
322.name: Edo Castle

skill.description: Restaura {value} de PS a todos los aliados. Los objetivos sufren un -{delay1} de daño temporalmente.
skill.name: Impenetrable Defense

abilities.description: Increases 25% of skill DMG.
abilities.name: Demon of Ruin

abilities.description: Skill attacks have 50% chances of inflicting Petrification
abilities.name: Wicked Smile

323.description:
"Ah, a sentimental sight indeed."
A spirit who will grant anyone's wish in exchange for their eternal soul. Finding himself in the mood for fireworks, Mephistopheles came to the festival, though even surrounded by its frivolities he maintained an inscrutable persona...mostly. In fact, Mephistopheles watched the fireworks display with a smile on his lips, a rare sight indeed. Those who witnessed the scene said that he looked as innocent as a child, though few things could be farther from the truth...
323.name: Mephistopheles[Fireworks]

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño al rival con más PS y lo quema con {probability}.
skill.name: Devil's Rocket

abilities.description: Increases 25% of Crit DMG.
abilities.name: Exploding Soul

abilities.description: Increases 20% of Crit Rate.
abilities.name: Noise Incarnate

324.description:
"Graghhh! My soul's about to burst!"
The spirit of a noisy firecracker. Dedicated to being as loud as possible, Firecracker turned to the two master firework artisans for assistance to grow stronger than ever. After receiving special gunpowder, Firecracker's powerful shout became a deafening roar. Although she may not soar through the sky like the rocket-type fireworks, Firecracker plays an important role in the festival, thundering along the ground and shaking spectators to their core. Even after the show is over, Firecracker entertains herself by exploding again and again...much to the ire of the Bureau of the Occult, who were swamped with noise complaints the following day.
324.name: Firecracker [Serious]

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño a una zona amplia de rivales.
skill.name: Thundering Chain

abilities.description: Normal attacks have 25% chances of inflicting Burn.
abilities.name: Blazing Spirit

325.description:
"I'm on fire! ...Oh, guess I was born that way."
The spiritual embodiment of fire, one of the four major elements. Hot enough to burn all that touch her, even a block of ice would turn to steam at the slightest touch. Because of this, Salamander specializes in missions in scorching hot environments, such as volcano craters. Participating in the annual fireworks festival, Salamander's rockets, known for their phenomenal power, are popular with spectators.
325.name: Salamander

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño a los rivales lejanos.
skill.name: World of Flame

abilities.description: Skill attacks inflict Paralysis.
abilities.name: Natural Phenomenon

326.description:
"Watch it, touch me and you're in for a shock!"
The spirit of floating balls of electricity. Ball Lightning can effortlessly command multiple orbs, each of which pack a punch as powerful as a bolt of lightning. If she's in the room when a fight breaks out, you can say goodbye to all your electronics. No doubt thanks to her elemental affiliation, Ball Lightning gets on with lightning beasts like a house on fire, so much so that when two or more of them get together in the Bureau of the Occult, you'll often hear lightning strike as they entertain each other. If ever you hear thunder in the corridors, keep away at all costs.
[Special Bond] Increases Raiju's skill DMG

326.name: Ball Lightning

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño a 2 rivales (prioridad a distancia), con {probability} de quemarlos.
skill.name: Lightning Bullet

abilities.description: Reduce enormemente la velocidad de ATQ del objetivo con ataques de destreza.
abilities.name: Maid of Iron

abilities.description: Sube enormemente el daño de destrezas.
abilities.name: Maiden in Name Only

327.description:
"We're all friends here, right?"
The spirit of a torture device that skewers its victims. She likes to boast that the face of the Virgin Mary emblazoned on the device makes her especially kind and loving, and she does manage to bring jobs to a close in a peaceful manner—most of the time, at least. No matter how evil the villain, she gives them a warm embrace and begs them to surrender...not so different from the Virgin Mary, in fact. There used to be rumors that she stabbed those she held with spikes, but one day, the rumors suddenly stopped. The ones who'd experienced her embrace were the first to deny the rumors, almost as if they were scared of something...
327.name: Iron Maiden

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to the enemy with the highest ATK.Targets deal {delay1} less DMG for a limited time.
skill.name: Deadly Embrace

abilities.description: Normal attacks have 5% chances of inflicting stun.
abilities.name: Special Sound

328.description:
"Fancy a tune? Then pay up!"
The spirit of a piper who could control living creatures with his music. He's known as a villain who used his powers to get revenge on villagers who refused to pay him, but the only "charm" he placed on the villagers' children was to encourage them to stand up to their parents. Once they saw how glibly the adults in their lives lied to them, they decided to run away for themselves. The bad rap has hurt Hamelin's music career and cost him a lot of money... Nowadays, he always insists on being paid up front.
328.name: Hamelin

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño a todos los rivales, con {probability} de aturdirlos.
skill.name: Pitch Perfect Parade

abilities.description: Sube ligeramente la velocidad de ATQ de los aliados.
abilities.name: Mythological Maker

329.description:
"Whatever ya need, I've gotcha covered!"
The spirit of a famous inventor from Greek mythology. In addition to building the labyrinth where the minotaur was kept, he also cobbled together a contraption for flying. He can make whatever you need, but his creations usually have some sort of flaw. For example, when pursuing a personal project to make spirit agents fly, he actually managed to do so with his manufactured wings. The only problem was that they'd fall apart if they went too high, which lead to the strange spectacle of spirit agents raining down from the skies. He's improved the wings a lot since then, but for some reason no one's volunteered to test them...
329.name: Daedalus

skill.description: Decreases attack speed of all enemies by {delay1} for a limited time.
skill.name: Pop-up Labyrinth

33.description:
«¿Me estás llamando "guía turística"? ¡Un poco de respeto, por favor!».
Un espíritu que se gana la vida organizando viajes para los dioses. Solía considerarse un trabajo sagrado e importante, pero, al igual que en nuestro mundo, las cosas han cambiado y organizar visitas guiadas por el mundo espiritual ya no es tan fácil. Se esfuerza todo lo que puede en memorizar los lugares de interés y las especialidades de cada lugar.
33.name: Yatagarasu

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño a los rivales de alrededor.
skill.name: Graznido de cuervo gigante

abilities.description: Increases 12% of skill DMG by all melee allies.
abilities.name: Barrier of Spears

330.description:
"Come now, time to prepare for the next battle!"
The spirit of a foot soldier that was feared on the battlefield. He passed up promotion after promotion in order to remain on the front lines, but people were nonetheless drawn to his strength and popularity. Before he knew it, he had a whole unit awaiting his command. He still fights on the front lines these days, but now he's got a team of allies to back him up. Much of their perceived strength is thanks to their imposing appearance, but that fact doesn't do much to put their enemies at ease.
[Event] Ghost in the Mirror
330.name: Commander Yashichi

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to the row of enemies directly in front.
skill.name: Commander at the Fore

abilities.description: Increases 40% of skill DMG.
abilities.name: Powerful Pressure

331.description:
"Ugh, why do I have to be so strong...?"
Daughter of Lü Bu, the most formidable and feared commander of China's Three Kingdoms period. She still sucks at acting, but her spirit essence is increasing more and more, even if that's not what she wants. Her poor performances at the end of battle are misconstrued as attempts to deceive her opponents, causing many to remark that she's not only strong but also smart. They may intend it as a compliment, but somehow she's never very happy to hear it.
[Event] Ghost in the Mirror
331.name: Lü Lingqi [Party]

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to current target.
skill.name: Breaking Point

abilities.description: Restores 10% HP to skill targets.
abilities.name: Power in the Scroll

332.description:
"Okay, seriously, where did it go?"
The spirit of a scroll with the portraits of 36 famous Japanese poets on it. The scroll was divided up into sections by poet and scattered across the land. After much searching, she's managed to recover about half of them, steadily regaining her strength as she goes. Despite looking everywhere for the rest, she hasn't had much progress, which is why she's been accepting jobs further away than she's normally willing to go. You could say a sense of despair is starting to sink in...
[Event] Ghost in the Mirror
332.name: Handscroll of Immortal Poets [Party]

skill.description: Increases DMG dealt by 3 allies (melee priority) by {delay1} for a limited time.
skill.name: Support of the Masters

333.description:
"Go on, yuk it up—I'm plenty strong!"
The spirit of a tiny warrior from a famous Japanese fairytale. His persistence allows him to turn the tables on foes in even the most dire of situations. His physical strength rivals that of Kintaro, thanks to the sheer amount of effort he exerts. And using the power of his magic mallet, he can temporarily grow bigger, too. But considering how small he starts out, "bigger" still isn't all that big...maybe around six feet?
[Event] Ghost in the Mirror
333.name: Issun Boshi

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to the enemy with the lowest HP.
skill.name: Skewering Blade

abilities.description: Increase 5% crit damage for all allies.
abilities.name: Too Comfy to Live

334.description:
"Hurry up and get iiin! It feels so nice and waaarm..."
The spirit of the heated kotatsu table, one of the most treasured objects in winter. She was involved in the creation of the Ultimate Kotatsu, which had the power to sap the lifeforce out of anyone, leaving them a listless, lazy husk. It became so powerful that in just a few days it nearly wiped out humanity. But in the end it was consigned to oblivion thanks to Sola and her friends. After experiencing it herself, Kotatsu became able to replicate the Ultimate Kotatsu's powers, with one small catch: it drains her own power, too, rendering her completely useless.
[Event] Ghost in the Mirror
334.name: Kotatsu [Party]

skill.description: Restores {value} HP to all allies.
skill.name: Toasty Trap

abilities.description: Restores 10% HP to skill targets.
abilities.name: Top Goddess

335.description:
" Ready to see what a real woman can do?"
The spirit of the goddess of marriage, motherhood and chastity. She came to the Bureau of the Occult in search of Zeus, but before she knew it she found herself bonding with the other women there. So she started a spontaneous lecture series to share her wisdom with all her new friends. Some expected it to backfire, but it worked out okay in the end. She even apologized to everyone afterwards, which shows how considerate she is. It just goes to show, you have to be strong to deal with a husband like hers.
[Event] Ghost in the Mirror
335.name: Hera [Party]

skill.description: Increases Crit Rate to all allies by {delay1} for a limited time.
skill.name: Goddess' Blessing

abilities.description: Increases attack speed by 20%, and reduces 20% of DMG taken at the same time.
abilities.name: Fast and Furiously

336.description:
"No one beats the Special Police Force in terms of teamwork."
The spirit of the man who led the swordsmen that once protected Kyoto. Putting the Special Police Force through rigorous training day after day, his pride in the organization grew to overconfidence. But Okita Soji was able to convince him of the value in accepting help from others when they have similar goals. Their cooperation should serve as a shining example for spirits and spirit agents alike for generations to come.
[Event] Ghost in the Mirror
336.name: Kondo Isami [Party]

skill.description: Increases DMG dealt by all allies by {delay1} for a limited time.
skill.name: True Battle Flag

abilities.description: Increases 10% of skill DMG of all anima allies.
abilities.name: Three Sacred Treasures

abilities.description: Reflects 10% of DMG taken back to attacker.
abilities.name: Ancient Mirror

337.description:
"Huh, so that's the way you do it..."
One of the Three Sacred Treasures of Japan and an intellectual who led the world to a more righteous order long, long ago. She's also the reason spirit agents can summon many different spirits. She believes that the relationship between humans and spirits could alter the balance of the world, and she's currently searching for a practical application of this theory. When she heard about a certain spirit and spirt agent with a powerful connection at the Bureau of the Occult, she headed over on the double...
[Event] Ghost in the Mirror
337.name: Yata Mirror

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to all enemies, with a {probability} of inflicting Stun.
skill.name: Mirrored Prison: Eternal Afterimage

abilities.description: Reduces 15% the DMG taken by skill targets.
abilities.name: Great Sage

abilities.description: Increases 5% of crit rate, and increases 20% of crit DMG of all targets at the same time.
abilities.name: Natural Genius

338.description:
"Need any strategic planning?"
The spirit of a genius tactician who made his name during the Three Kingdoms period of Chinese history. His ingenuity in service of Liu Bei helped avert numerous disasters, and the way he quickly grasps situations and offers the best possible path forward is like an art form. Many have asked him to teach them, but he always refuses. For the time being, he's devoted to various fields of study in order to help develop his younger sister's abilities. She's the one who told him about the Bureau of the Occult and all the spirits who come together there.
[Event] Ghost in the Mirror
338.name: Kongming

skill.description: Restores {value} HP to all allies; increases targets' speed by {delay1} for a limited time.
skill.name: Winning Wind

abilities.description: Normal attacks have 50% chances of inflicting Burn.
abilities.name: Trial by Catastrophe

abilities.description: All divina allies immune to Poison.
abilities.name: Hope Within

339.description:
"Just remember, anything is possible!"
The spirit of the first human woman in Greek mythology, and the guardian of a box of hope. The box is actually a processing unit that uses the power of hope to make anything possible. She played a big role in constructing Yata Mirror's alternate world, too. She can look into the future of anyone she lays her hands on, whether god or a demon, so many come to her for help. She generally gives it, too, as she's a sucker for sweets. Perhaps the reason she didn't grant Mikado's request for a glimpse into the future was because Mikado was unwilling to share her stash...
339.name: Pandora

skill.description: Restores {value} HP to all allies, with a {probability} of inflicting Weak Poison.
skill.name: Box of Hope and Despair

34.description:
«¡Ja, ja! ¡Te estoy viendo! ¡Vaya cara de pasmao!».
El espíritu de la que es considerada reina de los diminutos trasgos. Su trabajo consiste básicamente en causar problemas. Cuando otros espíritus se cruzan con ella (sobre todo si van a caballo o en carruaje), sus trasgos se abalanzan agitando sus porras, roban todo el oro y objetos valiosos, y se retiran. Son la pesadilla de cualquier mercader, aunque para un mercenario competente suelen ser una buena fuente de ingresos.
Vínculo especial Sube el daño de Brutrasga.
34.name: Trasgona

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño al objetivo actual, con {probability} de aturdirlos.
skill.name: Saqueo

abilities.description: 50% probabilityof moderately reducing all enemy's ATK speed at the start of every wave.
abilities.name: Temptation of Sloth

abilities.description: 70% chances of inflicting Silence to skill targets.
abilities.name: Perfection of Sloth

340.description:
"Temptation wins again..."
The spirit of the demon of sloth, one of the seven deadly sins. She's as lazy as ever, but she showed up to celebrate nonetheless. Surely it wasn't just so that she could ditch work... Pandora looked into her future, but she concluded that Belphegor will always be lazy, no matter what she does. Even in Yata Mirror's alternate world she couldn't manage to get out of a simple test grade kotatsu. So, she's pretty much exactly what you'd expect from the demon of sloth.
340.name: Belphegor [Party]

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to 3 enemies (melee priority), and decreases targets' speed by {delay1} for a limited time.
skill.name: Roar of Sloth

abilities.description: Increases 45% of DMG dealt when one of the Five Swords under Heaven is on the team.
abilities.name: Five Great Blades

abilities.description: Increases 30% of Crit Rate.
abilities.name: Body and Soul

341.description:
"Cutting through evil is all I do these days!"
The spirit of one of the Five Great Blades. After the you-know-what incident she's been working with demons to restore Shuten Doji's castle to its former glory. She used to get sent out on a lot of distant expeditions in the boonies, but lately she's had jobs closer to home, which has given her more time with her beloved Shuten Doji. They say this was all Mikado's doing, but she keeps her mouth firmly shut on the matter.
341.name: Dojigiri Yasutsuna [Serious]

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to enemy with highest ATK, target receives {delay1} more DMG for a limited time.
skill.name: Proof of Love

abilities.description: All melee allies take 10% less DMG.
abilities.name: Flute of the Gods

342.description:
"Hear that? That's the sound of battle!"
The spirit of a flute that signals the commencement of the final battle. The sound of the flute also gives a boost of encouragement to one's allies and summons assistance from the gods. However, in today's peaceful world without any wars between the gods, he has started using his powers to relay messages from the Bureau of the Occult to expeditionary forces in distant areas with poor cellphone coverage. More than anything else his voice is just really loud, so many spirits make sure not to tell him any secrets or personal information.
342.name: Gjallerhorn

skill.description: Increase damage dealt by 2 allies (ranged priority) for a limited time {delay1}
skill.name: Sound of Battle

abilities.description: Increases 2% max HP of all allies.
abilities.name: Divine Goblin Protection

343.description:
"Shall we say a prayer together?"
The spirit of a brave goblin with a strong sense of justice. A heroine among goblins, she worships the goblin gods of old and overcame great obstacles in order to obtain their ancient wisdom. No other goblins remember the old gods like she does—only she still knows their true names. These gods had the power to destroy the balance of the world, and so they altered goblins' memories to prevent their religion from spreading. That was the first time she resisted the gods' wishes. She refuses to forget how they sacrificed themselves for the greater good.
343.name: Gobluild

skill.description: Restore {value} HP to self, increase crit rate for a limited time {delay1}
skill.name: Prayer to the Old Gods

abilities.description: b2b6b3d
abilities.name: God of the Night

344.description:
"Sorry about my brother..."
The spirit of the god of night in Japanese mythology. Putting up with his sister Amaterasu and his brother Susanoo has been no easy task with everything going on between them. It all goes back to Susanoo's being transformed into a little girl by a mysterious curse. At first he searched as hard as he could for a way to lift the curse, but eventually he started thinking things were better as they were.
344.name: Tsukuyomi

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to the enemy with the highest ATK, with a {probability} of inflicting Silence.
skill.name: Lighteater

abilities.description: At the start of the final wave, all foes take 10% more damage.
abilities.name: Tough Break

abilities.description: Increases 9% of damage dealt by skill targets
abilities.name: A Bit of Luck

345.description:
"You can also turn disaster into fortune, you know..."
A spirit that latches onto people and drags them into poverty. Actually, what he really does is reverse wealth, not just from rich to poor but also from poor to rich. However, since losers tend to be louder than winners, everyone knows him as the god of bad luck and poverty. This has weakened his ability to bring wealth, whereas taking it all away comes to him easily.
345.name: Poor Devil

skill.description: Restores {value} HP to all allies and cures them of all negative status effects.
skill.name: Cycle of Suffering

abilities.description: Increases 18% of DMG dealt.
abilities.name: Twin Treasures

346.description:
"It doesn't matter how low I have to go—I will have my revenge."
A spirit who owns the treasured iron fan from "Journey to the West." When Sun Wukong came to borrow it, she did everything in her power to stop him. After many bouts of deception and trickery between the two, she finally gave up when her husband was defeated and forfeited the fan to the monkey king. Since then she's been training herself to live a more noble life.
346.name: Princess Iron Fan

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to the row of enemy directly in front, with a {probability} of inflicting Burn.
skill.name: Pale Gale

abilities.description: Skill attacks have 50% chances of inflicting Burn.
abilities.name: Barrage of Destruction

347.description:
"I got this...trust me!"
The spirit of a machine gun with a rotating barrel that must be cranked. She's the most trigger happy of all the spirits and leaves her opponents looking like Swiss cheese. Surprisingly, she's never suffered a single case of friendly fire because she always stays aware of her surroundings even while unleashing nonstop barrages of bullets. This has made her deeply trusted by her allies, who lovingly refer to her as "Sarge."
347.name: Gangr Gatling

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to all enemies.
skill.name: Bullet Annihilation

abilities.description: Skill attacks have 50% chances of inflicting Stun.
abilities.name: Favored Possession

abilities.description: Reduces 20% of DMG taken.
abilities.name: Mythical Tea Bowl

348.description:
"Charmed to meet me, I'm sure."
The spirit of a mythical spotted tenmoku tea bowl. The bowl had the power to bewitch anyone who laid eyes upon it. While a favorite posession of Oda Nobunaga, it was burned up with him in the Honnoji fire. As a spirit, her charm powers are as strong as ever, though their effect varies from person to person. But one thing's for sure—her colors are brilliantly iridescent!
348.name: Oda Tenmoku

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to the target with the highest ATK, with a {probability} of inflicting Burn.
skill.name: Conflagration

abilities.description: Increases 5% of skill DMG of all anima allies
abilities.name: Gauzy Ghost

349.description:
"Look! Look how high we are!"
A yokai made of cotton that dances and flutters in the skies. She likes to wrap around people and sweep them up into the air. But it's not done out of malice—she just likes seeing people get worked up and surprised. It's not like she carries them off to her lair or anything. In fact, she drops them off back at their homes with a special souvenir in hand. She especially loves getting a rise out of Sola, and snatches her up almost every single day...
349.name: Bolta Cotton

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to the enemy with the most HP. Decreases target's speed by {delay1} for a limited time.
skill.name: Mysterious White Cloth

35.description:
«Je, je, je... No me tengas miedo».
El espíritu de un cuchillo forjado para atravesar cosas gruesas. Cocinera y asesina ambulante, prepara unos platos únicos y de sabores exóticos... Ambos títulos le vendrían que ni pintados si fuesen reales. En el fondo, no es ni cocinera ni asesina.
35.name: Macheta

skill.description: Causa {value} de daño al objetivo actual.
skill.name: Ataca y corta

abilities.description: Restores 15% HP to the ally with the lowest percentage of HP at the start of each wave.
abilities.name: Special Salve

350.description:
"The medicine's ready!"
A spirit who slices those she meets, treats their wounds, and then runs away. She's dangerous since she loves cutting things with her beloved blade. The only problem is that she passes out at the sight of blood. So she always carries medicine to stop the bleeding and is quick to apply it after slicing someone. It's led to high demand for her skills in the medical field, and she's seriously considering making a career change.
350.name: Kamaitachi

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to the target with the lowest HP, with a {probability} of inflicting strong Poison.
skill.name: Bloodless Blade

abilities.description: Increases 10% of the skill DMG of all ranged allies
abilities.name: Help From the Shadows

351.description:
"So sleepy...just five more minutes, please!"
A spirit of the energy meridians deep within the Earth. Whenever your body's meridians run amok, this spirit is the one to fix it. She's been in collaboration with spirit agents since time immemorial, and there's no shortage to the wild stories. Also known to be violently desperate for more sleep, it's no exaggeration to say she's probably asleep if there's not an emergency at hand. But when she gets really into something she goes days without sleeping at all. In other words, she's a little extreme.
[Event] Guild Conquest
351.name: Ryumaku

skill.description: Increases all allies' DEF by {delay1} for a limited time.
skill.name: Power Spot

abilities.description: Increases 10% of the EXP gained from battle.
abilities.name: Hard Worker

from_description.event_name: Get Ready! The October Sports Meet at the Tokyo Blue Cemetery!

352.description:
"I'm starting to think this might just work out."
The spirit of a rabbit that was helped by a god. She has dreams that tell the future—albeit in fragments—but lately they've been getting more accurate. For example, the dream where she joined a sports festival held by someone who had helped her in the past. Many details of the festival and even her opponents were just as she saw them in the dream, which made her feel like she had a real chance of winning. But just how accurate was the dream, really...?
[Special Bond] Increases Okuninushi's skill DMG
[Event] Get Ready! The October Sports Meet at the Tokyo Blue Cemetery!

[Event] Get Ready! The October Sports Meet at the Tokyo Blue Cemetery!

[Special Bond] Increases {#MonsterName#361}'s skill DMG
[Event] Get Ready! The October Sports Meet at the Tokyo Blue Cemetery!

352.name: White Hare of Inaba [Sports Festival]

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to all enemies, with a {probability} of inflicting Petrifaction.
skill.name: Sweet Dreams

abilities.description: Normal attacks have 50% chances of Poison.
abilities.name: Ritual Decoration

from_description.event_name: Get Ready! The October Sports Meet at the Tokyo Blue Cemetery!

353.description:
"Yeah, black and white is the best!"
The spirit of a curtain with black and white stripes, originally used in Shinto rituals. At some point it started being used in funerals, and that's how it came to be best known. Today it's used at ceremonies at some of the highest-ranking shrines. He gets angry when people call the curtain "that thing they put up at funerals," but a few compliments always soothe his feelings.
[Event] Get Ready! The October Sports Meet at the Tokyo Blue Cemetery!
353.name: Kujiramaku

skill.description: Deals {value} DMG to all enemies. Targets deal {delay1} less DMG for a limited time.
skill.name: Shinto Gateway

abilities.description: Increases 5% crit damage for all allies.
abilities.name: Madness Maker

from_description.event_name: Get Ready! The October Sports Meet at the Tokyo Blue Cemetery!

354.description:
"Ready to be reduced to trash?"
The spirit of a demon whose name means "evil thoughts." She once fought under Ahriman against the gods of the heavens and has the power to make people incapable of distinguishing between right and wrong. No matter how saintly someone might be at first, she can reduce them to complete trash. So locking eyes with her is basically game over, socially speaking.
[Special Bond] Increases normal ATK by Angra Mainyu.
[Event] Get Ready! The October Sports Meet at the Tokyo Blue Cemetery!

changes.new:
